semantic_title: Factitious Disorder Coding - Self-Imposed and Imposed on Another
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 5. Chapter 5: Mental, Behavioral and Neurodevelopmental disorders > c. Factitious Disorder

content.full_text: Factitious disorder imposed on self or Munchausen's syndrome is a disorder in which a person falsely reports or causes his or her own physical or psychological signs or symptoms. For patients with documented factitious disorder on self or Munchausen's syndrome, assign the appropriate code from subcategory F68.1-, Factitious disorder imposed on self. Munchausen's syndrome by proxy (MSBP) is a disorder in which a caregiver (perpetrator) falsely reports or causes an illness or injury in another person (victim) under his or her care, such as a child, an elderly adult, or a person who has a disability. The condition is also referred to as 'factitious disorder imposed on another' or 'factitious disorder by proxy.' The perpetrator, not the victim, receives this diagnosis. Assign code F68.A, Factitious disorder imposed on another, to the perpetrator's record. For the victim of a patient suffering from MSBP, assign the appropriate code from categories T74, Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, confirmed, or T76, Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, suspected. See Section I.C.19.f. Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment (Evidence: pg no: 44, L68-L73)
content.summary: Provides comprehensive guidance on coding factitious disorders, distinguishing between self-imposed and imposed on another, with specific coding instructions for perpetrators and victims (Evidence: pg no: 44, L68-L73)
key_concepts: Factitious disorder imposed on self (Evidence: pg no: 44, L68-L69)
Munchausen's syndrome equivalence (Evidence: pg no: 44, L69)
Munchausen's syndrome by proxy (MSBP) (Evidence: pg no: 44, L70)
Perpetrator vs victim coding (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)
Abuse/maltreatment coding for victims (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use F68.1- for factitious disorder imposed on self/Munchausen's syndrome (Evidence: pg no: 44, L69)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a person falsely reports or causes their own symptoms, assign codes from subcategory F68.1- (Evidence: pg no: 44, L68-L69)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Perpetrator receives F68.A diagnosis, not the victim (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)
detailed_rules.explanation: In MSBP cases, the caregiver who causes or fabricates illness receives the factitious disorder diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign F68.A to perpetrator's record for MSBP (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)
detailed_rules.explanation: Code F68.A, Factitious disorder imposed on another, is assigned to the perpetrator's medical record (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use T74 or T76 codes for MSBP victims (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)
detailed_rules.explanation: Victims of MSBP receive abuse/maltreatment codes from T74 (confirmed) or T76 (suspected) categories (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)
common_applications: Elderly victims of factitious disorder by proxy

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if factitious disorder is self-imposed or imposed on another
Step 2: If self-imposed, assign F68.1- code to patient
Step 3: If imposed on another, identify perpetrator and victim
Step 4: Assign F68.A to perpetrator's record
Step 5: Assign T74/T76 codes to victim's record
Step 6: Reference Section I.C.19.f for additional guidance

code_ranges.description: Factitious disorder imposed on self (Evidence: pg no: 44, L69)
usage_rules: Use for Munchausen's syndrome (Evidence: pg no: 44, L69)
Assign to patient with self-imposed disorder (Evidence: pg no: 44, L69)

code_ranges.description: Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, confirmed (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)
usage_rules: Use for MSBP victims when confirmed (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)

code_ranges.description: Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment, suspected (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)
usage_rules: Use for MSBP victims when suspected (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)

specific_codes.description: Factitious disorder imposed on another (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)

breakdown.F68: Other disorders of adult personality and behavior

code_categories_mentioned: Adult and child abuse and maltreatment

references_to.title: Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment
references_to.explanation: Provides additional guidance for coding MSBP victims

coding_scenarios.scenario: Adult patient repeatedly presents with self-inflicted wounds and fabricated symptoms, diagnosed with Munchausen's syndrome
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient diagnosed with Munchausen's syndrome, history of self-inflicted injuries and fabricated medical complaints
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify factitious disorder imposed on self
Step 4: Document in patient's own record

correct_coding.rationale: Self-imposed factitious disorder/Munchausen's syndrome uses F68.1- codes (Evidence: pg no: 44, L68-L69)

incorrect_coding.rationale: F68.A is for factitious disorder imposed on another, not self
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Confusing self-imposed vs imposed on another

coding_scenarios.scenario: Mother brings child to hospital repeatedly with fabricated symptoms, diagnosed with MSBP
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Mother diagnosed with Munchausen's syndrome by proxy, repeatedly fabricating child's illness
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify MSBP/factitious disorder imposed on another
Step 2: Identify mother as perpetrator, child as victim
Step 3: Assign F68.A to mother's record
Step 4: Assign T74/T76 code to child's record

correct_coding.sequencing: Separate coding for perpetrator and victim
correct_coding.rationale: Perpetrator gets F68.A, victim gets abuse/maltreatment code (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72-L73)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Child is victim, not perpetrator - should get T74/T76 code
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Assigning factitious disorder code to victim

warnings: Perpetrator receives F68.A, never the victim (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)
Victims receive abuse/maltreatment codes, not factitious disorder codes (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)
best_practices: Clearly identify perpetrator vs victim in MSBP cases (Evidence: pg no: 44, L72)
Use appropriate abuse codes for victims (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)
Reference Section I.C.19.f for additional guidance (Evidence: pg no: 44, L73)
common_mistakes: Assigning factitious disorder code to victim
Confusing self-imposed vs imposed on another
Not using abuse codes for MSBP victims
clinical_context: Requires careful documentation of perpetrator vs victim
May involve legal and social services
